ARMY ORGANISATION

Army Strength: 22,000 (plus about 3,000 reserves) 3 x Combat Brigades

Royal Netherlands Army Outline Structure

Note:

There appear to be 5 x SF companies that include airborne, counter-terrorist and maritime capabilities.

SUPPORT COMMAND OUTLINE STRUCTURE

Note:

STAR - Surveillance, Target Acquisition and Reconnaissance Battalion; CIMIC - Civil-Military Co-operation.

11 AIRMOBILE BRIGADE

13 MECHANISED BRIGADE

43 MECHANISED BRIGADE

MAJOR ARMY EQUIPMENT

Main Battle Tanks 44 x Leopard 2A6 (possibly 60 available) Reconnaissance (Recce) 140 x Fennek (wheeled) Note: 438 x Fennek are in service in a variety of specialised battlefield roles. 6 x Fuchs (NBC Recce) Armoured Infantry Fighting Vehicle (AIFV) 184 x CV9035 (tracked)

Armoured Personnel Carrier (APC)

200 x Boxer - on order replacing YPR-765 between 2010-2016 (wheeled)

200 x YPR-765 (tracked  M113 type  being withdrawn) 112 x Bushmaster (wheeled) 80 x Patria XA-188 Sisu (wheeled) Artillery 57 x 155 mm PzH 2000 (SP  available) Mortars (Mor) 16 x 120 mm Brandt (towed) 150 x 81 mm  many of these L16 Anti-Tank (Atk) 130 x MRAT (Fennek AFV with Spike ATGW) 167 x SPIKE launchers Approximately 900 Panzerfaust (RL) Low Level Air Defence (LLAD) 18 x Stinger SAM (FIM-92A) on Fennek 18 x Stinger SAM (FIM-92A) MANPAD Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) 5 x EMT Aladin 32 x SAGEM Sperwer Some IAI MALE reported

NAVAL ORGANISATION

Navy Strength: 9,470 including 3,000 marines

Principal Units:

4 x Submarines

6 x Destroyers and Frigates

10 x Mine Countermeasure Vessels

Royal Netherlands Navy Outline Structure:

There are naval bases at Den Helder and Texel with overseas base at Willemstad (Curacao). There are Marine barracks at Rotterdam, Doom, Suffisant (Curacao and Savanete (Netherlands Antillies).

MAJOR NAVAL EQUIPMENT

Marines (3,000 personnel)

2 x Marine Infantry Battalions (1 x Bn integrated with UK 3 Commando Brigade)

1 x Amphibious Combat Support Battalion

1 x Amphibious Logistical Battalion

Reorganisation continues and the size of the Marine Corps may be increased.

Equipment includes:

74 x BVS10 Viking Personnel Carrier

20 x XA-188 Sisu APC

100 x BV206D Personnel Carrier

12 x 120 mm Brandt Mortars

32 x 81 mm Mortar

SPIKE ATGW

Stinger SAM MANPAD

AIR FORCE ORGANISATION

Air Force Strength: 9,500 (plus about 400 reserves)

Royal Netherlands Air Force Outline Structure

Notes:

(1) Air defence training and support for all three armed services is provided at the De Peel Airbase.

(2) 11 Airmobile Brigade trains at Deelen Air Base.

(3) Eindhoven hosts the European Air Transport Coordination Centre

MAJOR AIR FORCE EQUIPMENT

Fighter Ground Attack (FGA) 87 x F-16AM/BM Transport (Tpt) 6 x C-130 Hercules 2 x Fokker 50 1 x MD DC-10 1 x Gulfstream IV Air to Air Refuelling (AAR) 2 x KDC-10 Training (Trg) 13 x PC-7 Turbo Trainer Helicopters (Hel) 30 x AH-62D Apache 4 x SA-316 Alouette III (utility) 11 x CH-47D Chinook (6 more on order) 3 x AB-412 (SAR) 16 x AS-532U2 Cougar (utility) 21 x Lynx (ASW/SAR) being replaced by 20 x NH-90 Air launched missiles (ALM) AMMRAM (AAM) Sidewinder (AAM) Hellfire (ASM) Maverick (ASM) Surface to Air Missiles (SAM) 32 x MIM-104 Patriot Launchers 250 x Stinger (MANPAD)

CURRENT UNIT DEPLOYMENTS (over platoon strength  30 personnel. These are approximate figures)
